comment: Nice, friendly, and a bit unorganized. Gets straight to the point in the lab and if you are confused she will literally help you answer every single question. She created a really open environment where I felt I could get help with any equation I was confused about. Easy labs and I found myself leaving class early every day after collecting data.

Nice and easy, professor overall. The only thing is that she is a little unorganized and sometimes forgets things, but knows the subject. She is caring and very understanding, allowing you to retake the exams for a valid reason. Attendance is kind of mandatory just for both lectures (small quiz at the end) and the breakout session( just go to it).

Participation is 10% of your entire grade so do NOT skip class or the breakout sessions. The homework is very difficult and will take a while to complete so plan around it. She has a strong accent but her lectures are clear enough, though I did most of my learning on my own. She provides opportunity for remediation if you miss homework or a quiz.

She obviously cares and wants to be a good teacher, but it seemed like she had a long way to go. She was very unorganized and had a bad habit of just reading of slides without going in depth into concepts we should have been learning. Only take if absolutely necessary.

She is an incredibly kind and caring professor, and her grading scale is very fair. There were a few instances where I needed some extra assistance, but she was always more than willing to help. Just pay attention and do your work.
Had her for physics 2 lab. She was incredibly helpful and is an easy grader. Like in any class, just do your work and you'll get an A.

Is obviously new to teaching. Does not upload grades correctly or often to D2L. She seems like she hasn't looked at the slides or content prior to class. Took points off on multiple choice questions for "not showing enough work" when I asked her if the work was enough (at time of test, she told me it was sufficient, only to grade differently).

While I can see where some people might be coming from, she really was not all that bad.  You have to really pay attention during lectures to get anything out of them, but besides that, she basically put every question that was on the test in the study guide, and gave huge curves on every test.

I think she was a fine professor, her test curves were crazy good but there was a lot of homework and you have to teach yourself material outside. very nice and accessible outside of class. Would I take her again, no, but she is not a bad option and I think she deserves her credit since it was her first class.

This was the first time she had ever taught, and she wasn't prepared. However, she improved a little very weak, clearly cares, and is very knowledgeable. I think after some time she will be a good professor. Great lab prof. She made time to help if you asked. The rest of the class was very poorly behaved, take ratings with some salt. Easy tests.

I hate to say this but this professor was not the best. 100% of this class was self-taught, barely went to her classes. She was very caring, and her grading scale is great, but I understood about 40% of what I was doing in this class, even after going to recitation almost after every class and asking questions often. I would go with someone else.

New to KSU, didn't know how to use D2L. She struggles solving problems she assigns us and gets confused. Designs her tests to take 2 hours and “extends” lecture even though that isn't allowed. She doesn't put your grades into D2L so calculate it yourself. Says recitation is for a grade, but never added it into D2L. Avoid her if you want to pass.

She is a new professor at KSU... and it shows. This was probably the most unorganized course I've ever taken here at KSU. She doesn't seem qualified to teach the material at all. Her grading is also extremely confusing (she doesn't know how to use D2L). Her learning expectations for this course are not clear at ALL. please be aware.

I spent hours upon hours studying for this class, still to receives c's and b's on the test (before she curves them). I did not learn how to apply anything and learned very little from this professor. She also sometimes gets confused herself on how to solve the problems she gives us. Maybe she will do better next semester, but I highly doubt it.

Sudi is a new professor this year, and let me tell you, she cannot teach at all. She reads off a PowerPoint that she copies and pastes from the awful textbook and does not teach you how to apply anything. Also, good luck on trying to do the homework without the help of google. Chegg is the only way I learned how to do the homework.
